children.name: Selected External Code System Aliases (not complete)
children.description: Aliases for a subset of external code systems, based on package hl7.terminology#2.1.0 based on FHIR 4.0.1. Leading $ signs are optional but are useful for visually distinguishing aliases from other names.

children.name: Selected FHIR Aliases (not complete)
children.description: Aliases for a subset of code systems defined by FHIR from terminology.hl7.org. Leading $ signs are optional but are useful for visually distinguishing aliases from other names.

children.name: HL7 V2 aliases (complete)
children.description: Aliases for all V2 code systems defined at https://terminology.hl7.org/codesystems.html. Generated 2021-07-13 13:28:48 by https://github.com/FHIR/FSHOnline-Examples/tree/main/Scripts/Aliases/HL7.ipynb. Leading $ signs are optional but are useful for visually distinguishing aliases from other names.

children.name: HL7 V3 aliases (complete)
children.description: Aliases for all V3 code systems defined at https://terminology.hl7.org/codesystems.html. Generated 2021-07-13 13:28:48 by https://github.com/FHIR/FSHOnline-Examples/tree/main/Scripts/Aliases/HL7.ipynb. Leading $ signs are optional but are useful for visually distinguishing aliases from other names.

children.name: HL7 other aliases (complete)
children.description: Aliases for all code systems defined at https://terminology.hl7.org/codesystems.html that are not part of V2 or V3. Generated 2021-07-13 13:28:48 by https://github.com/FHIR/FSHOnline-Examples/tree/main/Scripts/Aliases/HL7.ipynb. Leading $ signs are optional but are useful for visually distinguishing aliases from other names.

children.name: Selected US Core Aliases
children.description: Aliases for a subset of US Core profiles and extensions. Leading $ signs are optional but are useful for visually distinguishing aliases from other names.

children.name: Complex Extensions
children.description: Examples of extensions with sub-extensions. Note that an extension cannot have BOTH a value and extensions.

children.name: Simple Extensions
children.description: Examples of extensions with values (no sub-extensions)

children.name: Contained Instance Example
children.description: An example of an instance that contains another instance which references its container

children.name: Instance Example
children.description: An example of an instance of a Patient resource

children.name: Date Format Regex
children.description: Example of regular expression that limits dateTime element to Dates (YYYY-MM-DD only)

children.name: Require Element OR
children.description: Invariant requiring one or both of two elements to be present

children.name: Require Element XOR
children.description: Invariant requiring one of two elements to be present (not both)

children.name: String Length Invariant
children.description: Limit string length invariant

children.name: Logical Example
children.description: An example of Logical resources and how to use them

children.name: Abstract Profile
children.description: Abstract profiles can be used to define common constraints used by multiple child profiles. The term "abstract" means that implementers would not create resources conforming to the abstract profile -- instead, they would target conforming to one of non-abstract child profiles. See "Shared Properties with Rule Sets" for an alternate approach to this.

children.name: Profile
children.description: Example of a profile of the Patient resource. This example includes a few of the most commonly used constraints and documentation features of FHIR profiles.

children.name: Shared Properties with Rule Sets
children.description: This is an alternative approach to using abstract profiles to define constraints that are common to multiple profiles using a FHIR Shorthand feature called "Rule Sets" (https://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/fhir-shorthand/reference.html#defining-rule-sets). See the "Abstract Profile" example for more information on abstract profiles.

children.name: CapabilityStatement Rules
children.description: Rules to populate a CapabilityStatement

children.name: Create Observation Component
children.description: Create Observation components easily using RuleSets

children.name: Set Extension Context
children.description: Specify which resources or elements an extension can be applied to

children.name: Set Short and Definition
children.description: Rule set to set the short name and definition for any element

children.name: Using Soft Indexing
children.description: Parameterized rule set using soft indexing

children.name: Shared Radiotherapy Rules
children.description: Share a set of rules among multiple profiles

children.name: Bundle Slice on Profile
children.description: RuleSet for slicing a Bundle on the profile of referenced resource

children.name: Category Slicing
children.description: Slice the category element so a certain category is required

children.name: Observation Component Slicing
children.description: RuleSet for Slicing Observation.component

children.name: Observation hasMember Slice on Code
children.description: RuleSet for Slicing Observation.hasMember on an element's value in the referenced resource

children.name: Slicing Identifier Element
children.description: Slice the identifier to require an implementer to support lab results accession number, filler order number and placer order number

children.name: Must Support Declarations
children.description: Basic Must Support declarations

children.name: Must Support on Resource or Profile
children.description: Put a MS flag on a profile (as opposed to an element in the profile)

children.name: Must Support on Selected Referenced Resource
children.description: Apply an MS flag to a Reference, for example, in Reference(Patient or Practitioner), put MS on Practitioner without a MS on Patient.

children.name: Exclude Single Codes
children.description: Value set with includes and excludes

children.name: Include Entire Code System
children.description: Value set comprised of an entire code system

children.name: Include Entire Value Set
children.description: A value set containing other value sets

children.name: Include Rules
children.description: Value set illustrating various include rules

children.name: Include Single Codes
children.description: Value set with explicit codes

children.name: LOINC Filtering
children.description: Value set example filtering on LOINC Part (LP) codes

children.name: SNOMED Filtering
children.description: Value set with includes and excludes
